alert.note: Alert for Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 7:28PM EST until January 10 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: .Runoff from prior rainfall and melting snow is expected. Flows in streams and rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in northeast West Virginia, Southeast Webster. In southeast West Virginia, Southeast Fayette and Southeast Nicholas. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster
